Description: Coin-weight: dīnār. Seven line Kufic inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also. OA+ 4183. From the same die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 134; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 68. Cf. Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 39; Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo, 21.

The bottom line is hardly visible on these specimens or any of the photographs but, as Miles has said, there is no question that Yazīd b. Abī Yazīd is meant, and not Yazīd b. Tamīn, whose name is associated only withʿAbd al-Malik b. Marwān. There are two other published dīnār-weight dies of ʿĪsā and Yazīd, with minor differences in the legend and its arrangement (Fahmi 1957, 67, 69). Bibliography: Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (139)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Yazīd b. Abī Yazīd
